fields.headline: £1m Beckham helps develop computer game
fields.bodyText: The earning power of footballer David Beckham was underlined yesterday when he signed an agreement to develop a range of computer games based on his performances for Manchester United and England. The three-year exclusive agreement between Mr Beckham, his agents SFX and games publisher Rage is likely to be worth in excess of £1m to the 26-year-old, who will receive royalties on each game sold plus an initial payment. The first units will go on sale in time for Christmas and will be a vital seller for the company, which yesterday announced an eight-fold increase in interim pretax losses. "Through the association with David we believe we can create a long-term strong and global game franchise," said Paul Finnegan, managing director of Rage., whose development laboratories are based in Liverpool, above. Mr Beckham is likely to receive £1 for every game sold. The announcement took the attention away from a disappointing set of results for the six months ending December 2000. The loss of £7.9m and revenues of £2.7m were in line with analyst's revised expectations following a series of profits warnings last year, however. Like many games companies, Rage is experiencing tough times. Shares closed down 1.5p at 5.5p.
